evidence: Fourier analysis follows two powerful principles
gives us a new way to look at a function - in terms of its frequency content
Multiple perspectives give us more flexibility
Use simple tools to solve complex problems

triples.evidence: Fourier analysis follows two powerful principles: Use simple tools to solve complex problems.
triples.o: simple tools to solve complex problems

triples.evidence: Fourier analysis follows two powerful principles: ... Divide big problems into small, manageable pieces.
triples.o: divide big problems into small, manageable pieces

evidence: There's also a deeper strategy here: Sometimes a function is complicated as a whole, but if we break it down into smaller, simpler parts, we can understand it better. This is the classic divide and conquer approach.
